messages.body:
$AXSM 
If only we had one drug like $MYOK

($MYOK) – The biotech company agreed to be bought by Bristol-Myers Squibb ($BMY) for $225 per share in cash, or $13.1 billion – a 61% premium to its closing price on Friday. MyoKardia’s lead drug is a treatment for irregular heart rhythms and the acquisition will lessen Bristol-Myers’ dependence on its lineup of cancer drugs.
$MYOK Why MyoKardia Stock Is Soaring Today http://dlvr.it/RhzbdR

links.title: Bristol-Myers Squibb Beefs Up Cardiology Franchise With $13.1B Deal To Buy Myokardia
links.description: Pharma giant Bristol-Myers Squibb Co (NYSE: BMY) is bulking up, as the company announced a multi-billion dollar deal to buy cardio-focused biopharma Myokardia Inc (NASDAQ: MYOK). Deal Terms: Bristol-Myers Squibb announced Monday a definitive agreement to buy Myokardia for $225 per share, or $13.1 billion, in cash.

It's in every hospital on the planet now but perhaps not for long! Question is...what side of the trade would you want to be on the day before possible news hits? I saw one investor that purchased contracts on Friday is worth a mere 1/2 million more this morning!
$MYOK should I stay or should I go?  If I go it will be $140 but if I stay it will be double!!  Happy I stayed ;)

$MYOK MyoKardia downgraded to Equal Weight from Overweight at Wells Fargo 09:13 MYOK, BMY Wells Fargo analyst Jim Birchenough downgraded MyoKardia (MYOK) to Equal Weight from Overweight with a price target of $225, up from $133, after the company agreed to be acquired by Bristol-Myers (BMY) for $13.1B in cash. With his estimate of $3B in peak sales for lead cardiac drug mavacamten, Birchenough views valuation at greater than4x peak sales as compelling and unlikely to be exceeded.

links.title: Bristol-Myers to buy heart drugs developer MyoKardia for about $13 billion
links.description: U.S. drugmaker Bristol-Myers Squibb said on Monday it would buy MyoKardia for about $13 billion to expand its heart drugs business and reduce its dependence on cancer treatments. Bristol Myers will pay $225 per share in cash, a 61.2% premium to MyoKardia's Friday closing price.
